Had this to. Server sends packet. But it’s the wrong one. Client can’t understand it. So it keeps asking the packet until its correct. But after few tries server can’t hold it. And shuts down all systems.

item.title: FOR SMART PEOPLE ( I Need Help ) Sorry Guys
item.dc:creator: @hot_server hot server
item.description:
@hot_server wrote:

Okay… so here’s my problem :o

I’ve just started using project czar again and i have a problem with making new shops and

moving the existing shops

Then i realised it’s all the second click npc’s!
Because of thieving npc’s giving the same error…

Heres the error i get :

java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: -61
        at client.parseIncomingPackets(client.java:18625)
        at client.packetProcess(client.java:17306)
        at client.packetSending(client.java:17275)
        at PlayerHandler.process(PlayerHandler.java:138)
        at server.main(server.java:53)
pimpscape Server [fatal] - exception

I’m not sure what to do!
Please help

here’s the line indicated and then the void it’s pointed to!

[code]public boolean packetSending() { //Ringer24: this is used for sending packets
return packetProcess();
}

private boolean packetProcess() {
	if(disconnected) return false;
	try {
		if(timeOutCounter++ > 20) {
			actionReset();
			saveStats();
			disconnected = true;
			return false;  }

		if(in == null) return false;

		int avail = in.available();
		if(avail == 0) return false;
		if(packetType == -1) {
			packetType = in.read() & 0xff;
			if(inStreamDecryption != null)
				packetType = packetType -

inStreamDecryption.getNextKey() & 0xff;
packetSize = packetSizes[packetType];
avail–; }
if(packetSize == -1) {
if(avail > 0) {
packetSize = in.read() & 0xff;
avail–; }
else return false; }
if(avail < packetSize) return false;
fillInStream(packetSize);
timeOutCounter = 0;

		parseIncomingPackets();	
		packetType = -1;
	} catch(java.lang.Exception __ex) {	__ex.printStackTrace();

disconnected = true;
System.out.println(“pimpscape Server [fatal] - exception”); }
return true;
}[/code]

Read full topic
